column1: Appendix table 7. Prisoners under the jurisdiction or in the custody of U.S. territories and commonwealths and prison facility capacity, December 31, 2014
Data source(s): National Prisoner Statistics Program
Appendix table 7. Prisoners under the jurisdiction or in the custody of U.S. territories and commonwealths and prison facility capacity, December 31, 2014
Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands

Note: Jurisdiction refers to the legal authority of state or federal correctional officials over a prisoner, regardless of where the prisoner is held. Custody refers to the physical location where the prisoner is held.
…Not available. Specific type of capacity is not measured by territory.
a/Does not include counts for American Samoa.

b/American Samoa has not submitted  National Prisoner Statistics (NPS) data since 2011. The data presented here were located in the 2013 American Samoa Statistical Yearbook (http://doc.as.gov/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/2013-Statistical-Yearbook-Final-Draft.pdf) and represent the number of persons in custody as of December 2013.
c/The U.S. Virgin Islands did not submit 2014 NPS data and had inconsistent 2013 data. Data used are from 2012.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, National Prisoner Statistics, 2014.
